title: psaverse
text: Use devtools remotes install package:
code: library(devtools) install_github("psysciacc/psaverse")

title: psaverse
code: library(psaverse)

what: Setting up a PSA Project Package
title: psaverse
text: First, need run psa_create_project() function including path want start folder computer name project. run function, new package R project open automatically (unless change open FALSE). Use R project complete rest steps ensure files/folders go correct directories.
code: psa_create_project(   path = "~/Github", # path you want this on your computer   psa_name = "PSA007-spaml", # name of the project    open = TRUE )

title: psaverse
text: can update description package using psa_update_description() function. license options: MIT License: “MIT” Apache License 2.0: “Apache” GNU General Public License: “GPLv2” “GPLv3” GNU Affero General Public License, version 3: “AGPLv3” GNU Lesser General Public License: “LGPLv2.1” “LGPLv3” Creative Commons CC0 Public Domain Dedication: “CC0” Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International: “CC-” Proprietary license: “Proprietary” Note: say yes asks want overwrite license! can add authors package project monitors lead author paper. author can one roles, indicated character string. Common roles include: “cre”: “creator” maintainer package. required one person can designated role. “aut”: Authors contributed package (maintainer). “cph”: Contributors hold copyright package. “ctb”: Contributors helped full authors (e.g., provided bug fixes, advice, minor contributions). “rev”: Reviewers. “trl”: Translator(s). check description file, now see new author description: want add , can use function, want delete people, need manually edit description file. ’s text file can opened RStudio text editor.
code: library(psaverse) # since you are in a new project psa_update_description(   package_title = "SPAML IS GREAT",   description = "Here's a serious description of the project.",   version = "0.0.1",   license = "GPLv3" ) psa_add_author(   given = "Lucy",   family = "van Pelt",   role = c("aut", "cre"),   email = "lucy@example.com",   ORCID_number = "LUCY-ORCID-ID") Package: PSA007-spaml Title: SPAML IS GREAT Version: 0.0.1 Authors@R:      person("Lucy", "van Pelt", , "lucy@example.com", role = c("aut", "cre"),            comment = c(ORCID = "LUCY-ORCID-ID")) Description: Here's a serious description of the project. License: GPL (>= 3) Encoding: UTF-8 Roxygen: list(markdown = TRUE) RoxygenNote: 7.3.2

title: psaverse
text: psa_create_folder("") create entire folder structure package, can also add one time. options: “ethics”: creates “01_Ethics” folder. “power”: creates “02_Power” folder. “materials”: creates “03_Materials” folder. “procedure”: creates “04_Procedure” folder. “data”: creates “05_Data” folder. “analysis”: creates “06_Analysis” folder. “communication”: creates “07_Communication folder. “”: creates eight main folders. parameter option added 08_Other folder.
code: # will create all folders  psa_create_folder("all")  # this will put a new folder in the other folder psa_create_folder("cheese")

title: psaverse
text: can manually move files need folder structure use psa_add_documents() function add individual files entire folders. function print list files moved , can see copied files folder.
code: psa_add_documents(   folder = "ethics", # where should it go   path = "~/Downloads", # to a single file or directory   should_replace = FALSE, # overwrite existing files?   recursive = FALSE # move all subfolders as well  )

title: psaverse
text: add R scripts .R .Rmd format, can use convenience function add libraries can found scripts. default examine files inst folder add packages.
code: psa_dependencies(     scan_folder = "inst",     add_package = NULL      )

title: psaverse
text: want make sure people can use files. Use psa_create_metadata() function create metadata csv file. need manually edit file. Folder options . function creates README.md adds bottom current readme. see output like : fill information CAPS, folder name, description folder, description files. Note structure file information folder markdown table, delete | --- ensure table renders correctly.
code: psa_create_metadata("ethics",                      overwrite = FALSE) (FOLDER NAME) documentation   (SHORT DESCRIPTION)   File information:  |name                                          |isdir |descriptions            | |:---------------------------------------------|:-----|:-----------------------| |Roles_Data.csv                                |FALSE |INSERT FILE DESCRIPTION | |supplementary data and codes.zip              |FALSE |INSERT FILE DESCRIPTION |

title: psaverse
text: user package able view folder contents dataframe using psa_view_folder():
code: psa_view_folder(folder = "ethics")

what: Add this Package to PSA GitHub
title: psaverse
text: First, confirm ability push PsySciAcc github organization https://github.com/psysciacc. Please ask added team. Second, can use psa_git() function initialize new project github repository associated PsySciAcc organization. can use favorite way github push pull update package. default create private repository ready release project. see message: Simply click usethis::use_git set folder GitHub repository. rerun psa_git().
code: psa_git() ℹ Defaulting to "https" Git protocol. Error in `check_uses_git()`: ✖ Cannot detect that project is already a   Git repository. ℹ Do you need to run usethis::use_git()?

title: psaverse
text: function check meet minimum requires documentation files PSA folder structure. receive information missing. Options: “ethics”, “power”, “materials”, “procedure”, “data”, “analysis”, “communication”, “”. get feedback project organized: can fix issues rerun function messages remain.
code: psa_check_folder(folder = "ethics") ℹ Checking O1_Ethics folder... • You need to include:    - README.md   - lab_ethics_summary.csv   - Collaboration Agreement   - PI_IRB   - Local_IRB   - No_Ethics   - Rely_PI ✔ Checking finished.

title: psaverse
text: want add citation project, can separate citation package, can use psa_citation(). can add features allowable bibentry(). function creates CITATION file, look like : package built, can use citation() function base R view citation project.
code: psa_citation(   bibtype = "Article", # default     title = "SPAML Greatness Achieved!",     author = "Buchanan, E.M.",     journal = "The Magical Journal of Cognition",     year = 2025,     url = "https://osf.io",     volume = 12,     number = 3,     pages = "45-67",     doi = "10.1234/example.doi" ) bibentry(bibtype = "Article",          title = "SPAML Greatness Achieved!",          author = c(person(family = "Buchanan"),                     person(family = "E.M.")),          journal = "The Magical Journal of Cognition",          year = "2025",          url = "https://osf.io",          volume = "12",          number = "3",          pages = "45-67",          doi = "10.1234/example.doi")

title: Authors and Citation
text: Leonardo Marciaga. Author. Erin M. Buchanan. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Marciaga L, Buchanan E (2025). psaverse: Archive PSA Projects. R package version 0.0.0.9000, http://psysciacc.org/psaverse/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {psaverse: Archive PSA Projects},   author = {Leonardo Marciaga and Erin M. Buchanan},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {http://psysciacc.org/psaverse/}, }

title: Archive PSA Projects
text: package psaverse facilitate archiving sharing data materials Psychological Science Accelerator projects standardized, transparent way. eventual goal collect number individual R packages developed PSA name collection.

title: Archive PSA Projects
text: can install development version psaverse GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("psysciacc/psaverse")

title: usethis project description functions — proj_desc
text: Quiet functions project

title: usethis project description functions — proj_desc
code: proj_desc(path = proj_get())

title: usethis project description functions — proj_desc
text: path file path

what: Add Author Info to PSA Project — psa_add_author
title: Add Author Info to PSA Project — psa_add_author
text: Adds person information Authors@R section DESCRIPTION file, creating field necessary. Acts wrapper function usethis::use_author() function.

title: Add Author Info to PSA Project — psa_add_author
code: psa_add_author(   given = NULL,   family = NULL,   ORCID_number = NULL,   email = NULL,   role = NULL )

title: Add Author Info to PSA Project — psa_add_author
text: given given name author family family name author ORCID_number ORCID number associated author email email address author role vector containing roles author project, usually "aut" "cre"; refer utils::person() documentation information.

title: Add Author Info to PSA Project — psa_add_author
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ psa_add_author(   given = "Lucy",   family = "van Pelt",   role = c("aut", "cre"),   email = "lucy@example.com",   ORCID_number = "LUCY-ORCID-ID") } # }

title: Add Documents to Project — psa_add_documents
text: function copies requested file/directory specified folder within project folder structure. requested folder already exist, created automatically.

title: Add Documents to Project — psa_add_documents
code: psa_add_documents(   folder = NULL,   path = NULL,   should_replace = FALSE,   recursive = FALSE )

title: Add Documents to Project — psa_add_documents
text: folder folder added. "ethics": creates "01_Ethics" folder. "power": creates "02_Power" folder. "materials": creates "03_Materials" folder. "procedure": creates "04_Procedure" folder. "data": creates "05_Data" folder. "analysis": creates "06_Analysis" folder. "communication": creates "07_Communication folder. parameter option added 08_Other folder. path path requested file/directory. Must valid path within current device. should_replace whether requested file must overwrite already existing one within project. recursive whether directories copied recursively.

title: Add Documents to Project — psa_add_documents
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ psa_add_documents(folder = "ethics",   path = "~/Downloads") psa_add_documents(folder = "ethics",   path = "~/Downloads",   recursive = TRUE) } # }

what: Check PSA Project Folder Structure — psa_check_folder
title: Check PSA Project Folder Structure — psa_check_folder
text: Checks current project's folder structure according PSAVerse standard structure, either one project folder (.e., 01_Ethics, 02_Power, etc.) time, everything .

title: Check PSA Project Folder Structure — psa_check_folder
code: psa_check_folder(folder = "all")

title: Check PSA Project Folder Structure — psa_check_folder
text: folder name folder check, "" check folders.

title: Check PSA Project Folder Structure — psa_check_folder
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ psa_check_folder("ethics") psa_check_folder("all") } # }

what: Create PSA Citation for Project — psa_citation
title: Create PSA Citation for Project — psa_citation
text: Allows user create citation GitHub /overall project users cite data files.

title: Create PSA Citation for Project — psa_citation
code: psa_citation(   bibtype = "Article",   title = "desc",   author = "desc",   journal = NULL,   year = NULL,   url = NULL,   ... )

title: Create PSA Citation for Project — psa_citation
text: bibtype character string BibTeX entry type. See Entry Types details. title title manuscript /title someone use cite resource. default argument "desc", case title pulled DESCRIPTION file. author author entry include author citation. Please see build project /update description format author entries. default argument "desc", case author(s) pulled DESCRIPTION file. journal journal location cite project. bibtype "Article", argument mandatory. year year citation project. url url include citation project. ... information can passed bibentry add details citation project.

title: Create PSA Citation for Project — psa_citation
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ psa_citation(   bibtype = "Article",   title = "My Package",   author = "desc",   journal = "My journal",   year = 2000,   url = "myurl.com" ) } # }

title: Create Folders in Project — psa_create_folder
text: function creates requested folder according PSA project folder structure: 01_Ethics, 02_Power, 03_Materials, 04_Procedure, 05_Data, 06_Analysis, 07_Communication, 08_Other, within inst folder. argument "", creates eight non-existing aforementioned folders. requested folder(s) already exist(s), throws error.

title: Create Folders in Project — psa_create_folder
code: psa_create_folder(folder = NULL)

title: Create Folders in Project — psa_create_folder
text: folder folder added. "ethics": creates "01_Ethics" folder. "power": creates "02_Power" folder. "materials": creates "03_Materials" folder. "procedure": creates "04_Procedure" folder. "data": creates "05_Data" folder. "analysis": creates "06_Analysis" folder. "communication": creates "07_Communication"folder. "": creates eight main folders. parameter option added 08_Other folder.

title: Create Folders in Project — psa_create_folder
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ psa_create_folder("ethics") psa_create_folder("all") } # }

what: Create Metadata for each folder — psa_create_metadata
title: Create Metadata for each folder — psa_create_metadata
text: Takes folder inst (, O1_Ethics, O2_Power, etc.), outputs README file filenames every file/subfolder given folder, also indicating whether files subfolders. space modifying description every file also created. files

title: Create Metadata for each folder — psa_create_metadata
code: psa_create_metadata(folder, overwrite = FALSE)

title: Create Metadata for each folder — psa_create_metadata
text: folder name folder documented. "ethics", "power", ..., "", must supply full path folder. overwrite TRUE/FALSE variable want overwrite previously created metadata file

title: Create Metadata for each folder — psa_create_metadata
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   psa_create_metadata(ethics, overwrite = TRUE) } # }

title: Create PSA Project — psa_create_project
text: Use function initialize PSA structured R project put GitHub share. Remember file paths need either "C:/Windows/blah" "C:\Windows\blah" using Windows machine.

title: Create PSA Project — psa_create_project
code: psa_create_project(   path = "./",   psa_name = "PSA000-demo",   given = NULL,   family = NULL,   email = NULL,   role = NULL,   comment = NULL,   open = FALSE )

title: Create PSA Project — psa_create_project
text: path path directory local project psa_name name repo (e.g., PSA000-demo) given given name first author family family name first author email email address first author role role first author, usually "aut" "cre"; refer documentation utils::person() details. may one "cre" (maintainer). comment additional information, e.g. ORCID number open Defaults FALSE, determine want immediately open new package RStudio window.

title: Create PSA Project — psa_create_project
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ psa_create_project(path = "~/Downloads", psa_name = "PSA001-Faces") psa_create_project(path = "C:\\Downloads", psa_name = "PSA001-Faces") } # }

what: Add R package dependencies for analysis code — psa_dependencies
title: Add R package dependencies for analysis code — psa_dependencies
text: function look .R .Rmd files R packages include package dependencies list. can tell scan specific folder - use default inst - add package directly. use add_package option, scan_folder ignored.

title: Add R package dependencies for analysis code — psa_dependencies
code: psa_dependencies(scan_folder = "inst", add_package = NULL)

title: Add R package dependencies for analysis code — psa_dependencies
text: scan_folder folder examined .R .Rmd files find package libraries add_package Add single set packages project, use c("package", "package") include several .

title: Add R package dependencies for analysis code — psa_dependencies
code: # psa_dependencies(scan_folder = "inst")

what: Add R package to PsySciAcc Organization — psa_git
title: Add R package to PsySciAcc Organization — psa_git
text: function initialize use github direct package included PsySciAcc organization. can use RStudio's built git push/pull, command line, favorite gui desktop app push pull github.

title: Add R package to PsySciAcc Organization — psa_git
code: psa_git(organisation = "psysciacc", private = TRUE)

title: Add R package to PsySciAcc Organization — psa_git
text: organisation "psysciacc" - please note confirm priveleges push organization first private TRUE/FALSE variable default start private ready release project package.

title: Add R package to PsySciAcc Organization — psa_git
code: # psa_git()

title: Create/Update PSA Project Description — psa_update_description
text: Create/Update PSA Project Description

title: Create/Update PSA Project Description — psa_update_description
code: psa_update_description(   package_title = NULL,   description = NULL,   version = NULL,   license = NULL )

title: Create/Update PSA Project Description — psa_update_description
text: package_title new title package description short description package functionality version version number package (default 0.0.0.9000) license license type package. Directly available options: MIT License: "MIT" Apache License 2.0: "Apache" GNU General Public License: "GPLv2" "GPLv3" GNU Affero General Public License, version 3: "AGPLv3" GNU Lesser General Public License: "LGPLv2.1" "LGPLv3" Creative Commons CC0 Public Domain Dedication: "CC0" Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International: "CC-" Proprietary license: "Proprietary" Refer documentation package licenses usethis package website available licenses.

title: Create/Update PSA Project Description — psa_update_description
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ psa_update_description(  package_title = "New Title",  description = "Short description",  version = "0.0.1.0000",  license = "MIT" ) } # } #

what: View metadata for a folder — psa_view_folder
title: View metadata for a folder — psa_view_folder
text: Allows view metadata folder PSA project.

title: View metadata for a folder — psa_view_folder
code: psa_view_folder(folder = NULL)

title: View metadata for a folder — psa_view_folder
text: folder folder want view metadata . following names can used: "ethics": "01_Ethics", "power": "02_Power" "materials": "03_Materials" "procedure": "04_Procedure" "data": "05_Data" "analysis": "06_Analysis" "communication": "07_Communication" "": "08_Other"

title: View metadata for a folder — psa_view_folder
text: dataframe file information folder
